Title: PostgreSQL: Multiple Vulnerabilities
Synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in PostgreSQL, the worst of which could lead to arbitrary code execution.

Background.Text: PostgreSQL is an open source object-relational database management system.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in PostgreSQL. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: Please review the referenced CVE identifiers for details.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All PostgreSQL users should upgrade to the latest version:

Code:
# emerge --sync
          # emerge --ask --oneshot --verbose ">=dev-db/postgresql-12.21:12"
          # emerge --ask --oneshot --verbose ">=dev-db/postgresql-13.17:13"
          # emerge --ask --oneshot --verbose ">=dev-db/postgresql-14.14:14"
          # emerge --ask --oneshot --verbose ">=dev-db/postgresql-15.9:15"
          # emerge --ask --oneshot --verbose ">=dev-db/postgresql-16.5:16"
          # emerge --ask --oneshot --verbose ">=dev-db/postgresql-17.1:17"
